t: Psalm 89
The Lord’s Covenant with David, and Israel’s Afflictions.
A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
I*pn will sing of the lovingkindness of the Lord*s forever; To*ln all generations I will make known Your faithfulness with my mouth.
For*ln I have said, “Lovingkindness will be built up forever; In*ln the heavens You will establish Your faithfulness.”
“I*ln have made a covenant with My chosen; I*ln have sworn to David My servant,
I*ln will establish your seed forever And*ln build up your throne to all generations.” Selah.
The*ln heavens will praise Your wonders, O Lord;*s Your*ln faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
For*ln who in the skies is comparable to the Lord?*s Who*ln among the sons of the mighty is like the Lord,*s
A*ln God greatly feared in the council of the holy ones, And*ln awesome above all those who are around Him?
O*ln Lord*s God of hosts, who is like You, O mighty Lord?*s Your*ln faithfulness also surrounds You.
You*ln rule the swelling of the sea; When*ln its waves rise, You still them.
You*ln Yourself crushed Rahab like one who is slain; You*ln scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm.
The*ln heavens are Yours, the earth also is Yours; The*ln world and all it contains, You have founded them.
The*ln north and the south, You have created them; Tabor*ln and Hermon shout for joy at Your name.
You*ln have a strong arm; Your*ln hand is mighty, Your right hand is exalted.
Righteousness*ln and justice are the foundation of Your throne; Lovingkindness*ln and truth go before You.
How*ln blessed are the people who know the joyful sound! O*ln Lord,*s they walk in the light of Your countenance.
In*ln Your name they rejoice all the day, And*ln by Your righteousness they are exalted.
For*ln You are the glory of their strength, And*ln by Your favor our horn is exalted.
For*ln our shield belongs to the Lord,*s And*ln our king to the Holy One of Israel.
Once*ln You spoke in vision to Your godly ones, And*ln said, “I have given help to one who is mighty; I*ln have exalted one chosen from the people.
I*ln have found David My servant; With*ln My holy oil I have anointed him,
With*ln whom My hand will be established; My*ln arm also will strengthen him.
The*ln enemy will not deceive him, Nor*ln the son of wickedness afflict him.
But*ln I shall crush his adversaries before him, And*ln strike those who hate him.
My*ln faithfulness and My lovingkindness will be with him, And*ln in My name his horn will be exalted.
I*ln shall also set his hand on the sea And*ln his right hand on the rivers.
He*ln will cry to Me, ‘You are my Father, My*ln God, and the rock of my salvation.’
I*ln also shall make him My*i firstborn, The*ln highest of the kings of the earth.
My*ln lovingkindness I will keep for him forever, And*ln My covenant shall be confirmed to him.
So*ln I will establish his descendants forever And*ln his throne as the days of heaven.
“If*ln his sons forsake My law And*ln do not walk in My judgments,
If*ln they violate My statutes And*ln do not keep My commandments,
Then*ln I will punish their transgression with the rod And*ln their iniquity with stripes.
But*ln I will not break off My lovingkindness from him, Nor*ln deal falsely in My faithfulness.
My*ln covenant I will not violate, Nor*ln will I alter the utterance of My lips.
Once*ln I have sworn by My holiness; I*ln will not lie to David.
His*ln descendants shall endure forever And*ln his throne as the sun before Me.
It*ln shall be established forever like the moon, And*ln the witness in the sky is faithful.” Selah.
But*ln You have cast off and rejected, You*ln have been full of wrath against Your anointed.
You*ln have spurned the covenant of Your servant; You*ln have profaned his crown in the dust.
You*ln have broken down all his walls; You*ln have brought his strongholds to ruin.
All*ln who pass along the way plunder him; He*ln has become a reproach to his neighbors.
You*ln have exalted the right hand of his adversaries; You*ln have made all his enemies rejoice.
You*ln also turn back the edge of his sword And*ln have not made him stand in battle.
You*ln have made his splendor to cease And*ln cast his throne to the ground.
You*ln have shortened the days of his youth; You*ln have covered him with shame. Selah.
How*ln long, O Lord?*s Will*ln You hide Yourself forever? Will*ln Your wrath burn like fire?
Remember*ln what my span of life is; For*ln what vanity You have created all the sons of men!
What*ln man can live and not see death? Can*ln he deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah.
Where*ln are Your former lovingkindnesses, O Lord, Which*ln You swore to David in Your faithfulness?
Remember,*ln O Lord, the reproach of Your servants; How*ln I bear in my bosom the*i reproach*i of*i all the many peoples,
With*ln which Your enemies have reproached, O Lord,*s With*ln which they have reproached the footsteps of Your anointed.
Blessed*ln be the Lord*s forever! Amen*ln and Amen.
